00035 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00036 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00037 
00038 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   4096
00039 
00040 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00041 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00042 
00043 #define xnarch_alloc_stack xnmalloc
00044 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00046 struct xnthread;
00047 struct task_struct;
00048 
00049 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00050 
00051     /* Kernel mode side */
00052 
00053 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00054     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00055        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00056     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00057     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00058     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00059     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00060        - NULL for RT K threads,
00061        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00062        - current for RT US threads.
00063     */
00064 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00065 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00066 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00067 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00068 
00069     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00070     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00071     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00072     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00073 
00074     /* User mode side */
00075     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00076     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00077 
00078     /* Init block */
00079     struct xnthread *self;
00080     int imask;
00081     const char *name;
00082     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00083     void *cookie;
00084 
00085 } xnarchtcb_t;
00086 
00087 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00088 
00089     unsigned exception;
00090     struct pt_regs *regs;
00091 
00092 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00093 
00094 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00095 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00098 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00099    Linux stack context. */
00100 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00101                                  ((fi)->exception != ADEOS_IABR_TRAP && \
00102                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP && \
00103                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP))
00104 #ifdef __cplusplus
00105 extern "C" {
00106 #endif

00108 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00109 
00110 {
00111 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00112     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00113         return vmalloc(bytes);
00114 #endif
00115 
00116     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00117 }
00118 
00119 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00120 
00121 {
00122 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00123     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00124         vfree(chunk);
00125     else
00126 #endif
00127         kfree(chunk);
00128 }

00133     rthal_irq_host_pend(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00142 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00143                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00144 {
00145     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00148 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00149 
00150 {
00151     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00152 
00153     adeos_load_cpuid();
00154 
00155     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00156        and always inside a critical section. */
00157     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00158     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00159     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00160 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00161     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00162     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00163     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00164                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00165                     : NULL);
00166 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00167 }
00168 
00169 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00170     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00171 }
00172 
00173 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00174                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00175 {
00176     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00177     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00178 
00179     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00180 
00181     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00182         {
00183         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00184 
00185         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00186 
00187 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00188         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00189            they don't work properly in our context. */
00190         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00191             asm volatile (
00192                 "dssall;\n"
00193 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00194                 "sync;\n"
00195 #endif
00196                 : : );
00197         }
00198 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00199 
00200         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00201         get_mmu_context(mm);
00202         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00203 
00204         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00205          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00206         current = prev;
00207         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00208 
00209         barrier();
00210         }
00211     else
00212         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00213         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00214 }
00215 
00216 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00217                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00218 {
00219     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00220 }
00221 
00222 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00223 
00224 {
00225     /* Empty */
00226 }
00227 
00228 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00229                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00230                                          const char *name)
00231 {
00232     tcb->user_task = current;
00233     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00234     tcb->ksp = 0;
00235     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00236 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00237     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00238     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00239 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00240     tcb->entry = NULL;
00241     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00242     tcb->self = thread;
00243     tcb->imask = 0;
00244     tcb->name = name;
00245 }
00246 
00247 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00248 
00249 {
00250     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00251     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00252     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00253     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00254 }
00255 
00256 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00257                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00258                                        void *cookie,
00259                                        int imask,
00260                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00261                                        char *name)
00262 {
00263     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00264 
00265     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00266 
00267     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00268     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00269     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00270     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00271     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00272     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00273 
00274     tcb->entry = entry;
00275     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00276     tcb->self = thread;
00277     tcb->imask = imask;
00278     tcb->name = name;
00279 }
00280 
00281 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00282 
00283 {
00284 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00285     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00286         rthal_enable_fpu();
00287 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00288 }
00289 
00290 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00291 
00292 {
00293 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00294     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00295        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00296     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00297     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00298 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00299 }
00300 
00301 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00302 
00303 {
00304 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00305 
00306     if(tcb->fpup)
00307         {
00308         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00309 
00310         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00311             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00312         }   
00313 
00314 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00315 }
00316 
00317 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00318 
00319 {
00320 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00321 
00322     if(tcb->fpup)
00323         {
00324         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00325 
00326         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00327             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00328         }   
00329 
00330     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00331        could be much lazier. */
00332     if(tcb->user_task)
00333         rthal_disable_fpu();
00334 
00335 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00336 }

00340 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00341 
00342     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00343 }
00344 
00345 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00346 
00347 {
00348     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00349                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00350                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00351                                      NULL,
00352                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00353 }
00354 
00355 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00356 
00357 {
00358     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00359                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00360                                      NULL,
00361                                      NULL,
00362                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00363 }

00366

00369     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00370 }
00371 
00372 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00374 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask)
00375 
00376 {
00377     return 0;
00378 }
00379 
00380 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00381 
00382 {
00383     return 0;
00384 }
00385 
00386 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00387 
00388 {
00389     return 0;
00390 }

00392 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00393 
00394 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00395 
00396 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00397 
00398 {
00399 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00400     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00401        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00402     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00403 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00404 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00405     xnshadow_release_events();
00406 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00407     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00408     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00409     schedule_timeout(50);
00410     xnarch_release_ipi();
00411 }
00412 
00413 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00414 
00415 {
00416     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00417 
00418     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00419         {
00420         spl_t s;
00421         splsync(s);
00422         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00423         splexit(s);
00424         return 1;
00425         }
00426 
00427     return 0;
00428 }
00429 
00430 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00431 
00432 {
00433 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00434     xnshadow_grab_events();
00435 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00436 }
00437 
00438 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00439 
00440 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00441 
00442 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00443 
00444     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00445     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00446     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00447 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00448     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00449     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00450 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00451     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00452 }
00453 
00454 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00455 
00456 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00457 
00458 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00459                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00460                                            const char *name)
00461 {
00462     struct task_struct *task = current;
00463 
00464     tcb->user_task = task;
00465     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00466     tcb->ksp = 0;
00467     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00468 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00469     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00470     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00471 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00472     tcb->entry = NULL;
00473     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00474     tcb->self = thread;
00475     tcb->imask = 0;
00476     tcb->name = name;
00477 }
00478 
00479 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00480 
00481 {
00482     unsigned irq;
00483 
00484     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00485         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00486                              handler,
00487                              NULL,
00488                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00489 
00490     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00491        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00492        individually. */
00493 
00494     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00495                          handler,
00496                          NULL,
00497                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00498 }
00499 
00500 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00501 
00502 {
00503     unsigned irq;
00504 
00505     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00506         {
00507         switch (irq)
00508             {
00509 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00510             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00511 
00512                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00513                 continue;
00514 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00515 
00516             default:
00517 
00518                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00519             }
00520         }
00521 
00522     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00523 }
00524 
00525 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00526 
00527 {
00528     unsigned irq;
00529 
00530     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00531         {
00532         switch (irq)
00533             {
00534 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00535             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00536 
00537                 continue;
00538 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00539 
00540             default:
00541 
00542                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00543             }
00544         }
00545 
00546     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00547 }
00548 
00549 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00550 
00551 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00552 
00553 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00554     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00555        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00556        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00557        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00558        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00559        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00560     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00561 }
00562 
00563 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00564     rthal_timer_release();
00565 }
00566 
00567 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00568 
00569 {
00570 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00571     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00572 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00573     return 0;
00574 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00575 }
00576 
00577 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00578                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00579                                         unsigned long long defval)
00580 {
00581 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00582     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00583     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ].t_handled;
00584     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ].t_synced;
00585 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00586     *shot = defval;
00587     *delivery = defval;
00588 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00589 }
00590 
00591 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00592 
00593 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00594 
00595 #include <linux/init.h>
00596 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00597 
00598 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00599 
00600 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00601 
00602 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00603 
00604 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00605 
00606 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00607 
00608 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00609 
00610 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00611 
00612 {
00613     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00614     fltinfo.exception = evinfo->event;
00615     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00616     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00617 }
00618 
00619 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00620 
00621 {
00622 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00623     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00624 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00625     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00626        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00627     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00628 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00629 }
00630 
00631 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00632 
00633 {
00634     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00635 
00636     if (!nktimerlat)
00637         return -ENODEV;
00638 
00639     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00640 
00641     return 0;
00642 }
00643 
00644 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00645 
00646 {
00647     int err;
00648 
00649 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00650     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00651        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00652     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00653 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00654 
00655     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00656 
00657     if (err)
00658         return err;
00659 
00660     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00661 
00662     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00663         return -ENOSYS;
00664 
00665     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00666                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00667                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00668                               NULL,
00669                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00670 
00671     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00672 
00673 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00674     err = xnshadow_mount();
00675 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00676 
00677     if (err)
00678         {
00679         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00680         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00681         }
00682 
00683     return err;
00684 }
00685 
00686 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00687 
00688 {
00689 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00690     xnshadow_cleanup();
00691 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00692     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00693     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00694 }
00695 
00696 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00697 
00698 #ifdef __cplusplus
00699 }
00700 #endif
00701 
00702 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00703 
00704 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00705 
00706 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00707 
00708 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_PPC_SYSTEM_H */
